channel.title: davewiner tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from davewiner.

item.description: Biden falls off bike during Rehoboth Beach ride, says 'I’m good.' https://t.co/U30tfM4kV9

A Covid theory... My friend visiting from out of town had Covid. We were together 3 full days. I didn't get Covid. Why? I got my second booster less than a month ago. At the same time I got pneumonia and shingles vaccines. The theory: My immune system was standing by.

The next part of the reallysimple project is a mailbox style reader that plugs in like a LEGO block. You want a different kind of reader? It'll be easy to plug it in too. Here's an idea what my demo plugin looks like. https://t.co/jT5uTDbj8e
@dietsociety that is exactly what journalism says. perfect. on the other hand we have big problems that will either kill us or get solved.

This sounds like what I've been saying about journalism forever. They write their consensus. They totally favor people who can help them, either by promoting or hiring. The powerful ones like where they are and don't want change. https://t.co/uJ3n3EC04D
But it is possible to get around journalism.
It has happened over and over since the web started.
And it's going to keep happening. My hope is that one of the times around the loop, the stranglehold journalism has on us will break. And then things can change.
@TaylorLorenz That's journalism Taylor. I tried to say that when we talked, but you tried to talk me out of it.

If DeSantis is the Repub nominee in 2024, I expect they will not have to resort to insurrection to win the White House. People will be tired of Biden and the wimpy Dems, and will want a fresh face, even if he is a white supremacist. https://t.co/n2EnBgbZDH

One of the benefits of doing the list of apps that support OPML is that I've learned that OPML is basically the standard for interchange between outliners. It's not a dream, it's a reality. https://t.co/1JXirgN3Hv

Marc Andreessen on Learning to Love the Humanities. Lots of interesting ideas about RSS. https://t.co/uTri2gMYCx
@pmarca -- I like your comments about RSS and podcasting in your interview above.
The reason social networks took over from RSS is imho that developers of RSS products wouldn't work together.
cont'd
The simple advantage Twitter had, for example, was how easy subscription was. In RSS each website presents its subscription info in a technically cryptic way. Too many steps. In Twitter when you see someone you want to subscribe to, just hit the Follow button.
cont'd
We could've done it in the RSS world, but devs would have had to cooperate.
20 lessons learned from the NBA playoffs. https://t.co/LyvKhoKn72
@Hjalm I didn’t ask for advice.
Proud Boys Led Major Breaches of Capitol on Jan. 6, Video Investigation Finds. https://t.co/dyjF85PGg2

Half my twitter timeline is Trump, speaking and tweeting. Please we've had a relatively Trump-free twitter for quite some time. Stop giving flow to the troll. I don't see many clips from Obama speeches in my twtr. https://t.co/a2XJZ0MTcL
@ElieNYC Your chapter on abortion will blow people’s minds.
@KenSmith Yes that was the idea. If one congressperson was killed that was the end.
Trump revelations at Jan. 6 hearings raise fears of a dark, violent future. https://t.co/fG4ijKpVf3
US TikTok User Data Has Been Repeatedly Accessed From China, Leaked Audio Shows. https://t.co/9r8LmaPXt5
Want to hear some great music? Ask Alexa to play Come on Eileen, and when it’s done ask for songs like the last one. Delicious.
Infighting Overshadows Big Plans at The Washington Post. https://t.co/0ODOrRZ2sr
They are getting very pathetic out there in Federalist land. https://t.co/Qq14Cw5z4B
@Hsquared_Studio Facts matter most to me as a reader. I don’t want the facts colored by your opinion.
A Comfy Dog Bed Specifically Designed for Humans. https://t.co/hloNwABcJL
@trickjarrett i've done it manually, it's a slog. i have hundreds of mp3s, all the earliest podcasts.
@trickjarrett please let me know when it's ready. ;-)
It's not radical to say what's true in clear language.
